issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: Is not a bug in our product
resolution.name: Not Our Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
h2. Problem description
When the iOS device is set to Slovenian (SL), Ti.Locale.getCurrentLanguage() returns the code for Slovak (SK). This makes the i18n translation files unreadable by the app.

h2. Steps to reproduce
- create the i18n folder and add a string for the Slovenian language (folder must be called 'sl')
- alert the L('sentence') value, or the Ti.Locale.getCurrentLanguage() response, in the app.js

h2. Expected results
The app uses the correct langage code (SL) and the translation is displayed correctly.

h2. Current result
The language code returned is SK, so the translation is not working properly.
fields.summary: iOS: when the device is set to Slovenian language (SL), Ti.Locale.getCurrentLanguage() returns SK (Slovak)

comments.body: This looks to be a problem with Apple: I've created a native app, and the Slovak language file is loaded when the device is set to Slovenian.
Closing this ticket as it is not our bug.
